Package utilities

Class BattleshipTests

java.lang.Object
utilities.BattleshipTests
class BattleshipTests extends Object
This class tests the backend of the Battleship game we made, except for the GUI and code related to GUI. The controller and model of MVC architecture, exception handling and edge cases have been thoroughly checked and a proper whole game has been simulated to test the processes and logic throughout the whole game. A part of the project, the GUI part have not been tested since it was not required. We achieved 100 percent coverage on controller and nearly 100 percent on the model
Author:
Luke Genova, Amimul Ehsan Zoha

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    (package private) void
    addShipTest()
    This method tests the adding/ placing of a ship and tests if the ship placed rightly changes the progress grid that holds the players' progress
    (package private) void
    exceptionTest()
    This method tests the exceptions thrown by some exceptional moves by the user which is handled in our battleship program.
    (package private) void
    filledSpacesFoundTest()
    This test tests the special case when a ship is placed vertically but then another ship placed horizontally overlaps and therefore throws an exception
    (package private) void
    filledSpacesTest()
    This test tests the special case when a ship is placed horizontally but then another ship placed vertically overlaps and therefore throws an exception
    (package private) void
    isGameOverAddShipTest()
    This method tests the case when a game is not over by making an incomplete game situation.
    (package private) void
    playerGridTesttest()
    This method tests the state of our player progress and player answer grids after a number of moves to ensure our inner data structures work fine
    (package private) void
    shipsHitTest()
    This method tests the case when a move causes to hit a ship.
    (package private) void
    wholeGameSimulationTest()
    This method tests a lot of things by doing a full game simulation where we have two players playing (two instances of each model and controller) and tests if the game is over when one player wins a game.

  • Method Details

    • addShipTest

      @Test void addShipTest()
      This method tests the adding/ placing of a ship and tests if the ship placed rightly changes the progress grid that holds the players' progress

    • exceptionTest

      @Test void exceptionTest() throws IllegalPlacementException
      This method tests the exceptions thrown by some exceptional moves by the user which is handled in our battleship program. assertThrows and lambda expressions have been used to test this.
      Throws:
      IllegalPlacementException - when a user places a ship at the wrong place or makes an illegal move

    • filledSpacesFoundTest

      @Test void filledSpacesFoundTest() throws IllegalPlacementException
      This test tests the special case when a ship is placed vertically but then another ship placed horizontally overlaps and therefore throws an exception
      Throws:
      IllegalPlacementException - when a user places a ship at the wrong place or makes an illegal move.

    • filledSpacesTest

      @Test void filledSpacesTest() throws IllegalPlacementException
      This test tests the special case when a ship is placed horizontally but then another ship placed vertically overlaps and therefore throws an exception
      Throws:
      IllegalPlacementException - when a user places a ship at the wrong place or makes an illegal move.

    • shipsHitTest

      @Test void shipsHitTest() throws IllegalPlacementException
      This method tests the case when a move causes to hit a ship. We further test if our player progress grid updates correctly
      Throws:
      IllegalPlacementException - when a user places a ship at the wrong place or makes an illegal move.

    • isGameOverAddShipTest

      @Test void isGameOverAddShipTest() throws IllegalPlacementException
      This method tests the case when a game is not over by making an incomplete game situation. We also test a few moves.
      Throws:
      IllegalPlacementException - when a user places a ship at the wrong place or makes an illegal move.

    • playerGridTesttest

      @Test void playerGridTesttest() throws IllegalPlacementException
      This method tests the state of our player progress and player answer grids after a number of moves to ensure our inner data structures work fine
      Throws:
      IllegalPlacementException - when a user places a ship at the wrong place or makes an illegal move.

    • wholeGameSimulationTest

      @Test void wholeGameSimulationTest() throws IllegalPlacementException
      This method tests a lot of things by doing a full game simulation where we have two players playing (two instances of each model and controller) and tests if the game is over when one player wins a game.
      Throws:
      IllegalPlacementException - when a user places a ship at the wrong place or makes an illegal move.
